website_summaries.verdict: Quality, durability and comfort at an unbeatable price.
pros: Integrated foam layer provides extra padding
Lightweight and compact without sacrificing comfort
Rolls up small enough for hiking
cons: "Self-inflatable", yet still requires a couple of puffs of air

website_summaries.verdict: It offers some quality features and durable construction, but if you prefer a larger model, you may want to consider others on our list.
pros: Features a partially self-inflating design that expands quickly w/few added breaths
Polyester shell provides insulation, and pad is easy to roll up and transport
cons: Some larger users say it's too narrow and short
Some side sleepers say the material is too thin

website_summaries.verdict: One of the higher quality self-inflating sleeping pads available for purchase, this clever product is sure to impress.
pros: Weighs only 2 pounds, with 1.5-inch thick padding
Material is water resistant for comfortable sleeping on all surfaces
cons: Not the most comfortable option for users who don't sleep on their backs

customer_reviews.title: ... made all the difference while remote camping between a good night's sleep and not
customer_reviews.text: It made all the difference while remote camping between a good night's sleep and not. With two people camping, we only bought one, because the male camper insisted he was tough enough to not need one. However, while camping he kept the female camper up half the night moaning and groaning about being uncomfortable. The female camper gave the pad to him, and he promptly fell asleep. The female camper was uncomfortable and secretly plotted her partner's demise, but at least he was quiet, blissfully sleeping on her pad. They will invest in another one for the next go around. The first few times we unrolled it, we had to manually blow air into it, but it self inflates now.
customer_reviews.author: Moot Pt

customer_reviews.title: From Five Stars... to One
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I hoped. Lightweight and added much comfort to camp sleeping, but by the second trip (months after the first), whatever separates the inside chambers came apart so it is flat on one side and greatly overinflated on the other. I'd like to order a replacement, but hesitate to do so.
customer_reviews.author: NETroy

customer_reviews.title: Aneurism
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for almost a year. Used it a few times. Has an aneurism by the valve. Kinda like a complementary pillow but it spreads the more pressure is applied. Also I can’t fully inflate the rest without excessive pressure on the aneurism.
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: So I had to give it one start because the ...
customer_reviews.text: So I had to give it one start because the one I got didn’t hold air. I bought this last Sept for a backpacking trip ths May. Unfortunately I should have slept on it before my trip? That way I could have returned it! Anyway, halfway through each night I would be on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: J Frendo

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Honestly really really upset that this didnt work out considering all the good reviews used it once while camping and once at home second time it had a huge bubble in it
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Easy and really comfortable! We bought them for backpacking and always use a blow-up matters when car/tent camping, but no need anymore, these are just as comfortable as that large blow-up mattress. And it is super light weight and smaller packed-up than I expected. Definitely a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Allie b.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a two week camping trip and it failed after one week. It worked adequately but just was not built to last. I have another much more expensive name brand inflatable mattress that has been going strong for nine years and I’ve slept on it at least 500 times and never had a problem or leak. The old adage applies here... you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: floodsurf

customer_reviews.title: Great ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I am planning a few backpacking trips this year and needed a compact sleeping mat. Look no further than this. It doesn't take more than a few seconds to inflate. My recommendation is to inflate it to about 50% and see how it feels. Then you can either reduce or increase the amount of air based on your preference. Deflating is easy and a lot less controversial than a football. This also comes with a carrying case that stores everything. I would highly recommend this if you need a compact sleeping mat for camping.
customer_reviews.author: MelanieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these for a 2 week camping road trip. 4 days in, one develops a bubble, the next day the other one stops holding air. Very disappointed, will be inquiring about the life time warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Warranty issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pad 2 months ago and after several uses the valve stem leaks air. I've try to warranty/register and it just takes me to fb messages! I don't have or care to use fb, is that the only way to communicate with thn? No phone # on their Web site, I've emailed directly from their site and no response! I'm lookin for thn to make this right, what crap to need fb to register.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Formed a bubble at the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: After the second use, sleeping pad has developed a bubble at the bottom. The bubble keeps getting bigger. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Westergard

customer_reviews.title: Happy then I wasn’t...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this, but after only owning for a few months and only after using it 2 times, the internal stitching has come loose and there is a huge lump that makes using this very unpleasant. At first, I thought that I could use the lump as a pillow, but even that is awkward... I should have spent the money and gotten something with a manufacturing defect clause, as Amazon tells me that I missed my window to return this! Ugh!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold needed air for support
customer_reviews.text: Was okay with the larger than described size when deflated and packed down. Was fine with it being less than premium quality when inflated and in use. Am not okay with the fact that it doesnt stay inflated. In terms of a self-inflating pad, it achieves less than that. I have 8 sleeping pads of various type, size, and quality, and this was supposed to be the "I dont care about weight, size, or comfort. It's better than the ground." It is the ground. On average, most of the needed "added air" is gone in 5 min.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Schweers

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and more warm than the lightweight sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: My son and I camped on both the lightweight TNH Outdoors sleeping pad and this TNH Outdoors self-inflating sleeping pad. I liked this one a little better as it has a little more padding. However, you sacrifice the weight with this one as it is slightly heavier than the lightweight due to its foam padding and r-value of 4.0. It definitely is built to last though with its silky, vinyl covering which is easy to clean and will not absorb water. It was very comfortable to sleep on all night in a tent in 40 degree weather. I highly recommend this sleeping pad if you're looking for one with a little more padding and comfort compared to others.
customer_reviews.author: Eric DIY

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after using a foam pad that left my back and hips sore, and kept me tossing and turning all night. When it arrived, I thought it looked too thin to do much good. But after a weekend camping, I have changed my mind. I slept so well! It was very comfortable and warm. It inflates by itself, and I did what other reviewers recommended and blew a few breaths of air in when it was done. It packs down small and even comes with a patch and instructions if you get a leak. Definitely worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. Easy to inflate, comfortable to sleep on. I store it open under my bed to keep the foam from compressing, and roll it up for transport to the campsite. Difficult to get it completely back in the pouch, so I don’t bother trying - I’m not backpacking so it rolls up small enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I used this a few times but the pad never inflated decently, per instructions, and didn't hold the air that entered it. Apparently others have better luck so wonder if it is a inconsistent manufacturing issue.
customer_reviews.author: CPE

customer_reviews.title: Ready to camp!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for camping. Very comfortable and easy to use. Spouse was able to deflate pad and put back in bag within seconds- very easy to do. Very helpful to have the black band that wraps around it to keep it together. Quality is superb. Very nice prime day had these for $35. Great deal. These will definitely last through lots of camping. Excellent product. Will be flying with these- both fit in our one large suitcase we are bringing.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This pad worked great on my backpacking trip. It is super lightweight, comfortable and kept me insulated. For the price, you can't find a better pad. The thing I was looking for the most is that none of my joints would be touching the ground while I slept. My hips and shoulders were supported all night every night. Keep in mind, it is still a sleeping pad—so I was ready for a bed after a couple of days, but if you want anything more comfortable, you need to spend $200 plus on a pad. This works great!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Seems like strong material, inflates easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep in my disaster go bag, so as of right now, I've not done more then inflate it to try it out. It inflates easily and it didn't take many of my own breathes to top it off. Laying on my back, my bottom touched the floor but I'm a side sleeper and laying on my side felt pretty good. My main reason for buying this was to keep me and my sleeping bag off of the cold ground if I needed to sleep outside in the winter. Seems like it would hold up to use. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, easy to inflate!
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable and easy to to inflate! I was looking for something like this for when I go camping (hate sleeping on roots / uneven ground or hard wood from the lean-to). Haven't tested it on the outdoors yet, but I did play around with it when it arrived. Tossed and turn to see how it would handle my weight (about 210 lbs right now), and took a nap on it. Comfy and def worth it for those who need a sleeping pad. Packs well into it's travel bag and without much hassle, and not as big as I thought it'd be either. Although, I wouldn't
customer_reviews.author: SilentBob890

customer_reviews.title: Consider other options before this one
customer_reviews.text: I used this pad while working on a trail crew and camping up to 8 days at a time for 5 months, sometimes in below freezing temps. It worked well in the beginning but wore out after 4 months and deflated overnight. It's also bulky and takes up a lot of of space. I wouldnt recommend this to anyone, with the exception of occasional car campers.
customer_reviews.author: SHmoopy

customer_reviews.title: Not that good. Update sucks
customer_reviews.text: Better than the ground but not by much. Didn’t support my weight very well and it lost air throughout the night. Have used it several times with the same results. In a real pinch it’s better than nothing but I wouldn’t recommend it. After using this product for a while I can honestly say it’s totally trash. A zip lock bag holds air better than these. I have 2 and both completely suck. If I could give negative stars I would. You should be ashamed to sell this garbage to hard working people.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome company and sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: TNH is an amazing company that really focuses on making their products environmentally friendly and customer satisfaction. They always send me emails after I purchase one of their products to see if it was okay and working properly. This product is everything that I was looking for. It is light weight and comfortable. You might need to add a few puffs of air for it to fully inflate but it could be because of how compact it gets. There is a foam layer for extra support that really helps, especially as someone who sleeps on thier side like I do. Overall a great product. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Outperforms Thermarest and costs much less!
customer_reviews.text: The TNH pad is better than a Thermarest because: 1. The TNH pad is more comfortable with less thickness 2. The TNH pad costs much less 3. The TNH pad rolls up tighter/smaller The TNH pad has holes through the inner foam. I'm not sure how these affect the performance, but the pad is very comfortable and rolls up very tightly. I don't know whether the holes are a TNH innovation or whether everyone is doing this now, but in any case they seem helpful. I will definitely buy more of these when we need more mats.
customer_reviews.author: centsworth

customer_reviews.title: look for a better one
customer_reviews.text: It's smaller and thinner then I thought. I dont know who would want to sleep like this? A friend of mine brought his (different kind) on our camping trip and he had two that zipped together and had a pillow in it. I would opt into looking at a different style and brand with more thickness and a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description
customer_reviews.text: These air mattresses are not self inflating as stated in the description. I took them on a canoe/camping trip this is weekend and they were much way larger, rolled up, than expected. Then once I unrolled them I found I still had to inflate them by self. I have them 2 stars because they were comfortable to sleep on considering their thickness but they provide no R value from the ground temp. They have been returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: They have done a great job of created a new self inflating mattress since we have bought and used the original brand that came up with the founding technology. TNH does it for far less money and makes an equally great product. One thing that needs to be considered is the after purchase contact TNH does with their Amazon customers, please don't. You make a great product but Amazon buyers don't want a relationship after the purchase unless we contact you first. Other than that we have been 5 star happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great camping pad
customer_reviews.text: Great camping pad! It is a little bigger than I would have liked, but even still it is pretty small and light--very packable for backpacking trips. It has kept me really warm, off the ground and much more comfortable than without using a pad. For the price, it's a great pad and certainly one that rivals its more expensive competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy...and a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I’m 6’ 275lbs and slept on the ground on this pad with zero complaints. It’s a bit slow to self inflate. But give it 20 minutes and put less than two breaths in it and you’re good to go. No leakage overnight no touching or feeling the ground. It rolls back up nicely into its stuff sack. And after a few uses I really do recommend it for the price. Will update later if any problems occur. But it does offer a lifetime warranty against defects if you register it on the tnhoutdoors.com website....so time will tell. But as said earlier I’m a big heavy guy, and so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mullett

customer_reviews.title: Not functional.
customer_reviews.text: This is not self inflating. It takes a whole lot of breaths to fill it up. It’s not very comfortable. It’s only about an inch thick.
customer_reviews.author: john ross

customer_reviews.title: Store un-rolled and flat??
customer_reviews.text: Inflated this the day it arrived. Grandkids played on it and napped. It held up under the grandkid test. Cannot wait to take it for a grandfather test. NOTE: only thing I did not like. Instructions say to store this un-rolled and flat. Meaning I have to find a place to store it in the big un-compressed fashion. Talk about difficult. So I deducted one star for the storage problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Cool Travel

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, good value
customer_reviews.text: After doing days of research I choose this TNH sleeping pad. It is slightly heavier but not by much. This thing is very durable and well made. I like that it is thick for comfort and I don’t worry that it will get punctured on trail. It rolls up small enough for my 50l pack and leaves me plenty of room. One other thing I’d like to mention is it is insulated which will help you on those colder nights. You won’t be sorry with this purchase, especially when you see those expensive mats that are out in the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: R. Valles

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great! TNH is quickly becoming one of my favorite ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great! TNH is quickly becoming one of my favorite brands. I recently purchased two of these sleeping pads and two TNH inflatable pillows for an overnight kayaking/camping trip with my son. Space was at a premium and price was too, but we needed good equipment as well. This pad is easy to inflate and really comfortable. Packs down into a small bag as well. After pricing supplies out at REI and other retailers I decided to try my luck with TNH and boy was I impressed. There are a number of similar products on Amazon but trust me, TNH is the way to go for economical but dependable outdoor supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage1977

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but soooooo bulky!
customer_reviews.text: If you are car-camping then this is probably a great pad. It's comfortable and not too heavy. However, if you're backpacking it just takes up way way way too much space. Like 20 liters probably! It does self-inflate pretty good but geeze you can get way smaller pads that only take a minute or two to blow up. I lend this one out to my friends now but I'll stick with my lame thermarest, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: A great deal!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time and appears to be a better deal than we expected! It even fit my son's 6' 2" height. Plus, when inflated, it at least an inch thick. We purchased this to replace the REI roll that was ruined for the fraction of their price.
customer_reviews.author: H. Demeny

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pack and comfortable sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: I ride a motorcycle and was looking for light, easily pack-able, and perfectly functional gear. I bought a summer, super lightweight sleeping back, so I knew I needed a good pad to put under it. This pad was exactly what I needed. Open the air valve & unroll, and the padding inside inflates it. Then close the valve & you're ready to sleep on a half padding, half air bed. Collapsing is easy as well, even when you're on uneven ground. I'm really glad I bought this. It made the world of difference on my weekend trip and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Miyake

customer_reviews.title: What I like about you
customer_reviews.text: The things I liked about this product were: 1. They listed an R value for the sleeping pad. Not sure how accurate it is but I liked that they knew that this is important. 2. The carry sack is over sized. So if you don't roll it up exactly right or if you are in a hurry in the morning you can get it in the bag every time. 3. They included a hook and loop cinch strap. This was such a great Idea I wondered why I hadn't thought of it before. I'm ording som more straps for my tent, other sleeping pads, ground cloths, etc..
customer_reviews.author: H Bart

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality doesn’t look like the image in the picture either
customer_reviews.text: The pad withstood one use... the material that is connected to the foam inside separated itself and the whole pad inflates like a balloon now. Comeplete junk do not waste your money. I slept in it for 2 hours in a hammock and now it’s junk.
customer_reviews.author: Cody tirrell

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to inflate, deflate, and fold up
customer_reviews.text: We use these for backpacking. Super amazing makes a huge difference when you're out in the woods sleeping on the ground versus sleeping on one of these pads. They're really easy to inflate and just as easy to deflate pulled up. Still fit in the same bag that we got it in. And it's really lightweight, which is helpful for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: christian Gingrich

customer_reviews.title: Item works great, self inflated pretty well but I usually give ...
customer_reviews.text: Item works great, self inflated pretty well but I usually give it a half a puff or full puff of air just to make sure. Rolls up easily. FYI I use this hiking and it is the largest piece of gear inside my backpack at roughly 14in long and 9 or so inches in diameter. It's not too heavy, just haven't figured out how to get the size down a bit, still 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: AIR LEAKED  the first time used
customer_reviews.text: I used this pad for the first time and it deflated the fist time I used it. Can’t find the leak so it’s pretty much worthless. Would be a good pad otherwise FML FML FML FML FML FML FML POOOOOOP
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small l, narrow, not very cushy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an overnight trip for my daughters class. Not easy to put back into back. Bottom gets very narrow. Not too thick but may be by design. Wanted it to be more comfortable and had high expectations that weren’t met.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Not really "self inflating"
customer_reviews.text: Used this during a camping trip recently. It's just slightly better than sleeping on the ground, but not by much. The ground that I was sleeping on was fairly level but it's still in the middle of the woods and this pad provided a bit of relief but not as much as the pad my friend was using. Also, my pad took 8-10 big breaths to get 100% inflated. The self inflating feature barely got it half way. It's not bad, but it's definitely not self inflating. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: TNH rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar experience as a previous review with a bubble growing next to my head while I was on it. Although this is completely understandable considering the company had just launched the product. I still give this company a five star review though because they were prompt to address my complaint and give me a full refund. My new pad is a fantastic product and is more comfortable than other pads I have tried. I have many other TNH products that I also love. I combine my hammock and my pad for a quick and easy night under the stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ada Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: After using this pad a few times I am in love with it. Its a fantastic quality and is simple to use. It takes about 10 breathes to blow up and is quick and easy to put away. Has mad camping much more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but don't like how it packs.
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine sleeping pad. I don't know how the "self-inflating" aspect works, and the way they described it in the instructions didn't really lead to any positive results. What bugs me the most about this pad is how it packs in that sack. I would like to to see in future versions of this for the carrying sack to be able to compress and get really tight. The packed shape of this pad is awkward and doesn't really fit well in or on a pack for a backpacking trip. I would like it to pack skinnier and longer than fat and wide.
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: What's with the good reviews?
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why there are so many reviews here saying it's comfortable; It's not, it's only slightly better than sleeping on the dirt. My back hurt every night and I would wake up every 3 or so hours to reposition myself.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Excellent company!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great company! I am very happy with the sleeping pad for outdoor and indoor use. We have used it about 6 times so far and always a great nights sleep. Also nice to see that TNH stand by their products with good follow up and lots of great offers! I own three of their products now and love them all!
customer_reviews.author: Casual Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: Just tried our new sleeping pads out on a trip and it was surprisingly comfortable. This pad does a great job of supporting the body when laying down evenly and you'd never know the pad was so thin. I was a bit worried when sitting on it, but once laying down, the weight is distributed evenly and this pad provides phenomenal support and is super comfortable. We originally got these for backpacking and overnight kayaking trips but we may retire our air mattresses as these are so comfortable and much easier to transport. I am also excited to be supporting a small business with great products.
customer_reviews.author: Naturally Ashlie

customer_reviews.title: Great product, my son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price. My son uses it for Boy Scout camping and has found it easy to use and comfortable. Love that it comes with its own carrying sack. TNH Outdoors has great quality products and excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for me!
customer_reviews.text: This pad has worked well for me. I am using it in my "she-cave." I've taken numerous naps on it. I usually nap on my stomach. I'm small framed and not a heavy person (110lbs). A large person (around 200) who is a side sleeper, might possibly have issues with pressure points. That's just a guess. Thus far, it seems sturdy and well made. Update 11/7/17: I went camping with this pad. The ground beneath was very hard. I slept comfortably and did not have any pain or stiffness, like I’ve had on sleeping cots and air mattresses. This pad is a definite winner.
customer_reviews.author: ckkjanzen

customer_reviews.title: Best camping sleep ever.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Bought it for summertime camping in Arizona, tried it out for the first time last weekend. I laid this out in my tent on a fairly rocky surface, it inflated quickly, but took a few breaths to completely pressurize. I Slept better than I ever have while camping. I'll never go without it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: I have been very pleased with this sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this self-inflating pad at the same time that I purchased a down under quilt. I use them both interchangeably. The TNH pad can be tricky to use at first with a sleeping bag, but with some patience and refining the "sag" of my hammock I was able to find a decent angle in the hammock so that the bag does not slip off of the pad and so the pad does not slip back towards the centerline. I have been very pleased with this sleeping pad. I will be using the pad later this week in a relatively hot summer environment.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Shepler

customer_reviews.title: Not much cushion
customer_reviews.text: I've used this sleeping pad around 3 different times and haven't been impressed. It takes so much effort for me to blow it up, and other people have tried and I've adjusted the valve, it's just difficult to inflate. And it really isn't very cushioned or comfortable. Maybe I just prefer something thicker, but this pad is not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Torres

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad!
customer_reviews.text: The most durable blow-up sleeping pad I've owned. Keeps air in all night. I prefer this one to more expensive brands you would find at REI. This one hasn't popped on me yet whereas my REI ones have multiple holes in them by now.
customer_reviews.author: SI

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for a camping trip we were going on. We normally just use pads as we are minimalist and prefer only having stuff that we can backpack with, however we are getting older (ugh!!) And wanted something a little more comfy. These worked AMAZINGLY. 2 days in a 2 man EMS shanty (purchased 5 yrs ago) tent and we have no complaints at all. Comfy, well made and compact!! Look forward to trying out for TNH products in the future!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jon sargent

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping pad!! I purchased two for a recent river trip. They are very lightweight and easy to set up and take down. I was very impressed with the comfort they provided when sleeping on the hard ground. Would definitely recommend for those who are looking for a little extra comfort without the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Buy this mattress!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mattress after going to BSA's University of Scouting training. It was highly recommended by one of the instructors. My 12 year old has used it on several campouts but I don't think he fully appreciates it. I finally used it and it was fabulous. It couldn't feel any rocks or twigs underneath me. When I got up in the morning I realized I had been sleeping on a prickly surface but I didn't feel any of it. This mattress takes up very little space. It is perfect. We will be buying more in the coming year.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Lite and Durable. Great for cooler nights.
customer_reviews.text: Still use at home for our daughter to sleep on our hard wood floor on sick nights. Husband used for 2 weeks to sleep on floor due to bad back and unable to get into bed. Great R value. Used at the superior hiking trail in summer tent at 35 F at night and was not cold from the ground. Great product. Light and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Perfect Touch Massage & Chiropractic Ltd.

customer_reviews.title: and like those older models
customer_reviews.text: The has come a long way from the self-inflating mats of my youth, but I'm only giving it three stars. The self-inflation part works, albeit slowly, and like those older models, I still had to do some manual inflation to get it full. The size is ok, not nearly as compact as other offerings. Comfort was so-so sleeping on the ground. Might be a touch better in a hammock or on a cot.
customer_reviews.author: <REDACTED>

customer_reviews.title: Bulky buys comfort
customer_reviews.text: The pad is a bit bulky in the bag, making it hard to compress for backpacking. However, it is fairly light weight and the bulk is the insulation that protects from rocks and cold ground. It is 1.5" thick, and very comfortable. Less slippery than other mattresses, have used on slight slopes and not slid off the mattress because of the fabric texture used. It is easy to inflate. This is one of the best I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Diana K.

customer_reviews.title: Self inflation no
customer_reviews.text: Had to blow into it forever. Not much difference than just laying on a hard floor. Not going into my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeyesgt

customer_reviews.title: easy to inflate
customer_reviews.text: I am 71 years old, I backpacked for four days into the Valhalla Provincial Park in British Columbia. The pad kept me very warm against the cold earth. At my age I need about four inches of padding for my hips and shoulders. I am a real believer in your pad, easy to inflate, rugged and holds its air. will text you a pic with my TNH pad if you send me you phone number. Thanks, Roland Morrison
customer_reviews.author: Roland Morrison

customer_reviews.title: and comfortable (relative comfort)
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Small, lightweight, and comfortable (relative comfort). It self inflates fairly quick and then a few breathes after it's fully inflated. It fit in my pack real well and isn't bulky like a foam pad. The nozzle to twist is very durable and tightens firmly without any give of the thread jumping. I didn't notice any air leakage either. Cons: Now, it still is thin and if you haven't moved any rocks from under the tent then you WILL feel it. It's not going to be the Ritz-Carlton sleeping, but adds a layer of cushion to a hard ground.
customer_reviews.author: nsdavis

customer_reviews.title: Great ground pad
customer_reviews.text: Great ground pad! I just used it camping for the first time for a couple nights and it was very comfortable. It’s a bit too narrow for my liking and it deflated a bit each night but I’ve heard self inflating ground pads deflate the first couple uses. Wasn’t a big deal, still was comfortable and did the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is high quality and compacts small. I was ...
customer_reviews.text: This is high quality and compacts small. I was hoping that it would have a little more padding, but it does it’s job. If you are looking for something small to provide some comfort this is for you. If you are looking for something that provide a lot of comfort look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Better than higher priced ones and VERY COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 55 yr old mom (5'7" 130lbs) for kayak trip around Glacier Bay NP. We camped on several rocky beaches and hard soil and she loved it! No sore hips or shoulders. Inflates easily to the advertised 1"+ and was very easy to roll back up. She also loved that her sleeping bag didn't slide off of it at all! Would be great for backpacking - very lightweight. Definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Twydell

customer_reviews.title: I love this sleeping pad and is perfect for camping!
customer_reviews.text: I love this sleeping pad! It is very light and very comfortable for its size. I love how they added more room on the shoulder's as well as the longer length. Being 6'0 feet tall this works perfectly! It is very easy to inflate and deflate and takes only a minute or two. Highly recommend for car camping or festival camping!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, comfortable, and the right price. I've purchased two of these and given one as a gift. Nothing but good things to say. If you are looking for a middle of the road sleeping pad that works on a weekend or a backpack trip this is it.
customer_reviews.author: BigGuyPNW

customer_reviews.title: Might as well sleep on the ground
customer_reviews.text: Might as well sleep on the ground. Light weight and easy to pack. Zero support. Not even comfortable lying on my back on a two night backpacking trip through Allegheny Nat Forest. The cheap Wal Mart pads are more comfortable, I know I've slept on both.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Far from Premium!
customer_reviews.text: Used 2 times now and the second time it separated inside creating large bubbles of air and not usable. To be called premium should not happen. Will not buy again!
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: ... form on the end of the pad I would like for them to send me a replacment very dissatisfied ...
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping pad was a fail I let it self inflate slept on it over night there was a big bubble to form on the end of the pad I would like for them to send me a replacment very dissatisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Adam burdine

customer_reviews.title: Great little mat for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck. Used these for the first time this weekend. I put a yoga mat under the air mattress and then a foamie on top. It was super comfortable! I wanted to try it without the foam and it was super tolerable. I would completely trust this mat alone on a backpacking/hiking trip. We had no issues with bubbling, but I think all you need to be careful of is overinflating the mat. This was great and fit to my body perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rookie_cookie

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Used this past weekend on the Appalachian Trail in a very rugged and rocky campsite. Worked great and provided comfort and insulation in 28 degree temps. Good value, thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Camping!
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought so wife and I could go camping again and needed new self inflating pad, price was right. Then Doctor changed my plans and I underwent a spinal fusion surgery. Guess what was a big help in getting me the cushioning I needed to rest? Wife put it under sheet for the bed, and it fits on my couch. Who needs to feel springs or supports? It worked great. TNH support has been in contact since I received it making sure everything is alright, and I think that says alot about the company. Pad is everything they say.
customer_reviews.author: TConrad

customer_reviews.title: TNH is good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't been camping in quite some time so had never heard of TNH... I took a chance on this pad and couldn't be happier. It is durable. It is thick. It is. comfortable. I'm 5 10" 225 lbs and tested it on my kitchen floor. Laying on back would be best of course but even on my side I was not feeling the floor. I'm confident to take it camping. Probably too heavy for the backpacking crowd.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: Usede this backpacking this past weekend in the FLat Tops wilderness. Despite there being a large pile of leftover snow a few feet away, this pad kept me warm. Utilized in conjunction with a ground cloth, and inside a bivvy sack. I'll be interested to see how it holds up over time, but so far it is a very comfortable upgrade from a RidgeRest foam pad.
customer_reviews.author: everyman

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: We slept on these all last weekend. They were comfortable and fit well in a backpacking tent. As comfortable as our other big name sleeping pads at a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Z.

customer_reviews.title: ) and it worked GREAT! We were taking down and setting up camp ...
customer_reviews.text: Took it on a 3 week camping trip. Usually I have to use an air mattress while camping so my back doesn't give me fits. I slept on this for the 3 weeks (even side sleeping!) and it worked GREAT! We were taking down and setting up camp almost daily, so we definitely put it through the paces of being well abused. It held up nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Jes380

customer_reviews.title: Valve problem
customer_reviews.text: I have had this For about a year, we used it for the first time and we went camping at Hatteras, NC. my wife got this pad but was very disappointed as the valve would not hold the air inside the mattress. Even though it is padded she did not sleep well on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sleeping pad, easy to inflate/deflate and stow away
customer_reviews.text: I'm a scout leader and take this with me on all of my camping trips. It's served me well. It inflates easily and deflates quickly. Easy to roll up and stow in the bag. Great sleeping pad to take along on a backpacking trip too. There's enough extra room in the bag after I pack it to slip in the small inflatable pillow that I bring along.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top notch for low price.
customer_reviews.text: I immediately opened and set up the sleeping pad as soon as it got here. It inflates some but not completely although, with a few extra breaths it was firm and ready to go. I was worried I would have a hard time finding a comfortable pad since I am a side sleeper, but after laying on this I was pleasantly surprised! Once I was done I opened the valve, rolled it up like instructed to, and packed it away all very quickly. TNH Outdoors even sent me a follow-up email to verify that the package had arrived. Can't wait to get out and field test it! :D
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Mattress came as described. Unfortunately it is not comfortable at all and I could not sleep on it. Also does not pack up very small for easy carrying. Unfortunately I bought this before going on a 3 week vacation and only used it once before buying a new one due to the comfort. I am now out of the return window because I was away for an extended time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This pad is so comfortable! It dosent take much air to blow up
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'1" tall and weigh about 190 lbs. This pad is so comfortable! It doesn't take much air to blow up, and it fits my height perfectly. I would definitely recommend this item if you are looking to spend a night out under the stars. My only issue is that I don't fit completely on the pad due to the pads taper. I am still giving it a 5 star rating because I still sleep really well/comfortably using this item.
customer_reviews.author: michael robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this for camping. He's about 90 pounds and sleeps on a wire Murphy bed. He can't feel the wires through this at all and even better, I don't have to worry about it popping, like I would a standard inflatable mattress. My only complaint is that it's a little narrow, but this allows for it to slip easily inside your sleeping bag, so it's not much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary C. Parr

customer_reviews.title: Decent sleeping pad at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for an overnight camping trip. Wasn't the most comfortable sleeping pad, but it was better than sleeping on the ground. Inflates easily. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Gold

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, durable, but small
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, durable, but smallI think this is a quality product, but I did not give it a five because it is too small. It is great if you are one of those people that sleep in one position but I am not. It in place by itself which is a great feature. I would absolutely recommend it if it was a little bigger
customer_reviews.author: anita doran

customer_reviews.title: Great pad.
customer_reviews.text: Great pad... been hiking along Lake Superior for a month now... started in mid September... So it has been cool... this pad has performed flawlessly... it holds air well On rocks, moss, sand you name it! It rolls down very small, lighter and smaller than my old z-light and dries quickly if it does get damp in a torenchal downpour with 60 mph + winds! I TRULY would purchase it again... also I weigh 210 and it only really deflates a little if I don't re-air each day! Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Wieczorek

customer_reviews.title: Weight vs additional Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Too much weight for the value on this purchase. I decided to add the extra weight to my pack that this pad required, thinking it would provide me with a better base than a typical foam mat/Yoga mat would, but it didn't. On a positive note, it is pretty easy to fold back up and get into the pouch for storage. Backpacking, I won't take it due to the weight vs lack of additional comfort. Camping, I will definitely take it since I won't have to lug it around.
customer_reviews.author: Crys

customer_reviews.title: good fit
customer_reviews.text: nice and comfortable fits in hammock nicely can really feel temp difference update received in Jan 17 use it in hammock almost every weekend in backyard where it is vulcanised ( the dimpled parts) some have come apart so now there is a big bubble under my knees about 8 x10 inches wide. still holds air but makes it annoying feeling it throughout the night
customer_reviews.author: walter

customer_reviews.title: it stabilizes the hammock and most importantly it's a great insulator on a cool night
customer_reviews.text: This pad is a necessity for any hammock. More than just the comfort aspect, it stabilizes the hammock and most importantly it's a great insulator on a cool night. You can't beat the easy of setup either, the self inflating feature works quickly and easily, although it doesn't firm up as much as I would like. This can easily be remedied by blowing some extra air into the pad before closing the deal. All in all, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a weekend camping trip
customer_reviews.text: I don't camp often (bought and used for 1 weekend camping trip), so can't say if this particular brand/model pad is better than any other pad. But, I can say that it was very comfortable for my weekend camping trip. I found it easy to setup, and easy to pack. Seems pretty durable, and I'd expect it to last. Also, I like that it packs fairly small. Maybe too big for carrying on a backpack trip, but for car camping it's a great size allowing more room to pack other stuff. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Pad for Camping
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice sleeping pad. It seems very comparable to other brand pads I've purchased that are much more expensive. It is comfortable to lay on and seems like it will insulate me from the ground very well in colder temperatures. The self inflating works like other pads I've used. I typically am not patient enough, so I'll blow them up a big through the fill valve then seal it. Seems durable and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: c1sower

customer_reviews.title: A lightweight and sturdy pad
customer_reviews.text: First time getting a self inflating pad. It takes a little longer to get the bottom inflated. I am a side sleeper and this pad does a pretty good job at keeping me comfy. I am 5'3 and 120 pounds. The build of the pad looks sturdy and likely they used quality materials to make it. The only thing I don't like about it is how is packed. It is an odd shape. It's takes a lot of space inside of the bag or difficult to secure it to outside my bag. Overall it's a lightweight and comfy pad.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as ThermaRest (or better!)
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I bought this for my wife for when we go camping because the hard ground really hurts her hips and shoulders. We tried yoga mats, but those are a joke when it comes to getting a good night's sleep. I have an old ThermaRest inflatable sleeping pad, which I've had for over 20 years, and so we decided to find something like that for my wife. We found and bought this one from TNH Outdoors, and it is every bit as good as (possibly better than) my old ThermaRest. Not to mention, it looks cooler and rolls up a lot smaller! I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice pad. Leave the valve open and the pad ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice pad. Leave the valve open and the pad starts to inflate. Only a breath or two more of air and it's fully inflated. The pad is definitely comfortable. Comes with a nice strap and carrying bag. The material used for the pad is nice. The pad is very well constructed. As with other TNH Oudoors products, the valve is constructed to make inflating and deflating a breeze. I can see why it's rated the #1 premium self inflating sleeping pad.
customer_reviews.author: CycleParadise

customer_reviews.title: As someone with a history of back problems, I ...
customer_reviews.text: As someone with a history of back problems, I was nervous heading out on a horseback hunt in the Colorado mountains. I needed something that was lighteweight, packed down small, but was durable enough for a spike camp on the mountainside. This pad allowed me to wake up and be ready to go in the early morning every day for 6 days. My hunting partners were jealous that they hadn't done more research into a sleeping pad. They will be using this pad the next time out. I am 6' 2" and 190 and it worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: PackFanDC18

customer_reviews.title: Will never camp without this!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this sleeping pad. It's small enough to fit in my pack with my sleeping bag and clothing without having to compromise on other items for space. It inflates easily and requires minimal manual filling- ie will not pass out trying to fully inflate this pad. Only downside is that it only fits 1 person, which is great for me, not so favorable for my jealous tent mates.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra

customer_reviews.title: Finally my hip pains are gone!
customer_reviews.text: I went from a $100 sleeping pad to this one and honestly wasn't expecting much but I was definitely wrong. This one is a little bulky compared to my old one but I have had hip pains when sleeping outdoors for years and FINALLY I found a sleeping pad that helps! Definitely worth my money!
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm M.

product_meta.title: TNH Outdoors Premium Self Inflating Sleeping Pad Lightweight Foam Padding and Superior Insulation Great for Hiking & Camping Thick Outer Skin
feature_bullets: "Awesome sleeping pad, very high quality for your back pocket. Comparable to Thermarest for a fraction of the cost" ~ Self Inflating Pad, Customer

✔ FEEL REFRESHED - We’ve all been there - that tired, grumpy feeling in the morning after a night of DISCOMFORT as you twist and turn, trying to get comfortable on a lumpy or deflated sleeping pad. Wake up READY to explore with the TNH Outdoors Self Inflating Sleeping Pad.

✔ DISCOMFORT- You won’t feel those jagged rocks or the uneven ground. Our 1.5inch thick design ensures that they go UNNOTICED for an ultimate night of COMFORT. Those bumps and uneven surfaces found beneath the tent floor WILL GO UNNOTICED with this thick and compact sleeping pad! We promise you that our price will give you the best VALUE for your dollar.

✔ PROVEN - We have sold 30,000 of this model since launching 12 months ago. You will be pleased to know that we are seasoned Amazon Sellers and will honor your LIFETIME WARRANTY, supporting you and your loved ones.

✔ EASY INFLATION - With a 500 series pneumatic valve, just twist it open, unroll the pad and it will start to inflate itself! A few simple puffs of air from a healthy set of lungs and you have a pad so good you will forget you even left your bedroom! Couple with a 75D polyester outer shell - strength and durability is a feature of this sleeping pad! Make punctures a thing of the past and get gear that will GO THE DISTANCE!

✔ GUARANTEED - The Rakaia Designs (TNH Outdoors) brand offers THE BEST VALUE and we stand by our customer ratings! Better still, if for any reason you are unsatisfied, just let us know and we'll fix it. From refund to replacement, we are here to make sure that you are satisfied.
